doc:
Michael McKean https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_McKean 0 Michael McKean (born October 17, 1947) is an American actor, comedian, and musician, known for a variety of roles played since the 1970s. McKean's first big role was playing annoying neighbor Lenny Kosnowski on the sitcom Laverne Shirley. In the mid-1990s he was a repertory cast member on Saturday Night Live. He has played roles in several Christopher Guest ensemble films, particularly as David St. Hubbins, lead vocalist and co-lead guitarist of the fictional rock band Spinal Tap in This Is Spinal Tap. He co-wrote the song "A Mighty Wind" (from the film of the same name), which won a Grammy Award, as well as "A Kiss at the End of the Rainbow" from the same film, which was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Song. McKean portrayed Chuck McGill, brother of Saul Goodman, as a series regular on the AMC drama series Better Call Saul from 2015 to 2018. Michael_McKean ( born October_17_,_1947 ) is an_American_actor , comedian , and musician , known for a_variety of roles played since the_1970s . McKean 's_first_big_role was_playing annoying_neighbor_Lenny_Kosnowski on the_sitcom_Laverne_ . In the_mid-1990s he was a_repertory cast member on Saturday_Night_Live . He has_played roles in several_Christopher_Guest_ensemble_films , particularly as David_St._Hubbins , lead vocalist_and_co-lead_guitarist of the_fictional_rock_band_Spinal_Tap in This Is Spinal_Tap . He co-wrote the_song " A_Mighty_Wind " ( from the_film of the_same_name_) , which won a_Grammy_Award , as_well_as " A Kiss at the_End of the_Rainbow " from the_same_film , which was_nominated for the_Academy_Award for_Best_Song . McKean portrayed Chuck_McGill , brother of Saul_Goodman , as a_series_regular on the_AMC_drama_series_Better_Call_Saul from 2015 to 2018 .
